DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to investigate, if exposure-based cognitive therapy (EBCT) is at least as effective as the established cognitive-behavioral therapy and more effective in its long-term efficacy. Moreover the mechanisms of change of the EBCT are investigated.
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Clinical Trial of an Exposure-based Cognitive Therapy for Depression
DOC.criteria: Major Depressive Disorder according to DSMIV as main diagnosis minimum standardized depression scores (BDI >= 17; HAMD >=13) minimum age of 18 years informed consent to participate voluntarily in the study sufficient German language skills acute suicidality depressive disorder with moodincongruent psychotic features chronic depressive disorder organic cause of depression druginduced depression bipolar disorder diagnosis of schizophrenia, schizophreniform, schizoaffective disorders, and/or psychosis NOS comorbid dysthymia, psychotic disorder (acute or anamnestic), dementia, substance dependence, schizotypal/ borderline/ or antisocial personality disorder psychopharmacological treatment other than antidepressants antidepressant medication, if it is changed within one month prior to the beginning of psychotherapy other simultaneous psychological treatments
